intro: Coumarouna panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian coumarouna, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a distinctively aromatic scent. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, while its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
